unittitle.value: Brooklyn Society of the New Church records

extent.value: in seven manuscript boxes, one custom box, and two metal filing drawers.

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: This collection consists of records of the Brooklyn Society of the New Church for the period circa 1850 to 1960, including trustees minutes; neighborhood club records; visitors books; minutes of the executive committee; registers of marriages, baptisms, births, and funerals; Sunday school minutes; church committee minutes; scrapbooks; handwritten reminiscences; subscriptions to church expenses; church income reports; the Society's constitution; membership lists; and card files.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Society of the New Church records, 1994.002, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1994.

The Brooklyn Society of the New Church was a Swedenborgian church organized in the 1850s. In 1869, the church purchased land at Clark and Monroe Streets that had formerly belonged to the Universalist Church of the Restoration.

This collection consists of records of the Brooklyn Society of the New Church for the period circa 1850 to 1960, including trustees minutes; neighborhood club records; visitors books; minutes of the executive committee; registers of marriages, baptisms, births, and funerals; Sunday school minutes; church committee minutes; scrapbooks; handwritten reminiscences; subscriptions to church expenses; church income reports; the Society's constitution; membership lists; and card files.
